Bay Area Open Science Group
A virtual community for Stanford, UCSF, UC Berkeley and beyond

2022-2023 Meetings

Date Title Presenter Summary
August 2022 Open Science
Team Agreements		 BAOSG Facilitators Open Science Team Agreements Template discussion and incorporation of feedback from attendees
September 2022 #FOAMed (Free Open Access Medical education) Dana Larsen (UCSF) Innovations in open curriculum for nephrology students
October 2022 NASA TOPS (Transform to Open Science) Curriculum Development Natasha Batalha (NASA Ames) An introduction to the development of an open science curriculum as part of the NASA TOPS initiative for the 2023 Year of Open Science
November 2022 Federal Open Science Policies BAOSG Facilitators Review of the 2023 NIH Data Management and Sharing Policy and the 2023 OSTP Memo
February 2023 Project TARA (Tools to Advance Research Assessment), Building Blocks for Impact Ruth Schmidt (Institute of Design, Illinois Tech) Discussion of assessing impactful research through an open science lens.
March 2023 Open and Reproducible Science at Stanford Joshua Buckholtz (Stanford) Discussion of the intersection of DEI and Open Science principles and practices.
April 2023 Open Science in Bioengineering with the Fraser Lab Robbie Diaz and Christian Macdonald (UCSF) Discussion of the culture of Open Science in the Fraser Lab, the opportunities it has presented and impact it has had on members.
May 2023 Open Data Steve Diggs
(UC California Digital Library)		 Discussion of data activism, data loss, and the four steps in data publishing.
June 2023 ChatGPT and SciHub, an informal chat BAOSG + Albert Lee (UCSF) Discussion on the intersections between ChatGPT and SciHub and how researchers use them to find information.
